content.description:
Neptune surveys his domain.
 Interea magno misceri murmure pontum
 emissamque hiemem sensit Neptunus et imis
 stagna refusa vadis, graviter commotus; et alto
 prospiciens, summa placidum caput extulit unda.
 Disiectam Aeneae toto videt aequore classem
 fluctibus oppressos Troas caelique ruina,
 nec latuere doli fratrem Iunonis et irae.
 Eurum ad se Zephyrumque vocat.
content.question: From lines 5-6 (Disiectam . . . ruina) we learn that the Trojans were

choices.label: sad to leave their city in ruins
preparing their fleet for a sea battle
searching the shore for shipwrecked comrades

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
